properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 2:31PM PST until January 23 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...SNOW WEDNESDAY...

.A warm front will bring snow to the Washington Cascades and
northern Blue mountains Wednesday. Snow levels will begin to rise
Wednesday night eventually changing precipitation to rain below
5000 feet.

* WHAT...Snow expected with 4 to 8 inches above 3500 feet and
lesser amounts below.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon.

* WHEN...From 10 AM Wednesday to 4 AM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will begin around 2500 feet
then rise to around 5000 feet Wednesday night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM WEDNESDAY TO 4 AM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
